content: what s better than a free hat pattern 12 free hat patterns of course this year we re releasing a new free hat design in germantown on the 3rd tuesday of each month **worthy of note** the april hat is worked in the round from the bottom up the ribbing on the brim is worked in a faux cable pattern with twisted stitches there is an increase row worked before beginning the body of the hat which creates a beret shape the puff pattern is worked with a crochet hook inserting the hook into the space between stitches a few row below and creating floats on the right side of the work the stitch takes a bit of practice but is fun to do **specifications yarn** kelbourne woolens germantown salmon 667 1 skein **gauge** 17 sts + 24 row = 4 10 cm in puff on larger ndls after blocking **needles** 1 16 40 cm us 6 4 mm circular 1 16 40 cm us 7 4 5 mm circular 1 set us 7 4 5 mm dpns *check your gauge and adjust needle size s accordingly if necessary * **notions** size g-6 4 mm crochet hook stitch marker tapestry needle pom pom maker kelbourne woolens label sewing thread sharp sewing needle **size** 16 75 43 cm brim circumference unstretched 28 25 71 75 cm body circumference 8 20 25 cm height **skills** knitting purling bobbles twisted stitches puff pompom images linette kielinski
